instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only green light
threads.message: Hi guys I have a macbook air that came in with liquid damage. Liquid at <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and I replaced <CAPACITOR>C6100</CAPACITOR>. Also liquid around SMC replaced: <CHIP>U3710</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q5158</TRANSISTOR> & <RESISTOR>R5158</RESISTOR> and did a SMC reflow for good measure. When connecting power the fan starts to spin (not 3 times though) and I get only a green light. After about 30-40 seconds the board switches off. CPU gets hot, I got <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> on <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> and when I connect a mouse i do get a red light so it seems the SMC is doing something. PPBUS is at 8.17v though which usually indicates faulty SMC? Any suggestions?

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only green light
threads.message: 8.17V would at least indicate an issue with the SMC. The switching off after 30 seconds can be many things including the SMC. Also suspect are the traces and/or termination resistors from <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> to the SMC.

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only green light
threads.message: OK will check more thoroughly thanks Duke!
